alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 11 at 1:33PM MST until January 13 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM FRIDAY TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, extreme cold expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Mission Valley, Flathead Valley, Polson, and Flathead Lake. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 AM Friday to 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
